reference.scope: VARIANTS [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] CYS-486; ARG-607 AND TRP-628

comment.text: Dual specificity kinase acting on both serine/threonine and tyrosine-containing substrates. Phosphorylates serine- and arginine-rich (SR) proteins of the spliceosomal complex. May be a constituent of a network of regulatory mechanisms that enable SR proteins to control RNA splicing and can cause redistribution of SR proteins from speckles to a diffuse nucleoplasmic distribution. Phosphorylates SRSF1 and SRSF3. Regulates the alternative splicing of tissue factor (F3) pre-mRNA in endothelial cells.
Leucettine L41 inhibits its kinase activity and affects the regulation of alternative splicing mediated by phosphorylation of SR proteins.
Co-localizes with serine- and arginine-rich (SR) proteins in the nuclear speckles.
Autophosphorylates on all three types of residues.
Lacks the kinase domain. May be produced at very low levels due to a premature stop codon in the mRNA, leading to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. CMGC Ser/Thr protein kinase family. Lammer subfamily.

property.value: Expressed in bone marrow and 229 other tissues
